news.title: Mupfurutsa takes PSL Chair role after an election victory
news.content:
Story by ZBC Reporter
ISAIAH Mupfurutsa has been elected Chairperson of the Premier Soccer League following elections held in Harare this Friday.
The Simba Bhora Chairperson, Mupfurutsa, got the mandate to oversee the administration of the top-flight league after being elected ahead of Dumisani Sisale of FC Platinum, Leonard Musariri of Ngezi Platinum Stars, and Manica Diamonds’ Masimba Chihowa.
Highlanders’ Kenneth Mhlophe landed the Vice Chairperson’s post unopposed, while Dynamos’ Moses Maunganidze and Oscah Nduwure of TelOne were elected Emergency Committee members.

news.title: Chaminuka suspended without pay as Dynamos struggles continue
news.content:
Story by ZBC staff reporter
Troubled Harare giants, Dynamos, have suspended coach Saul Chaminuka for allegedly breaching the employment code of conduct.

news.title: Zimbabwe eyes gold as development archers shine in Namibia
news.content:
Story by ZBC staff reporter
THE Zimbabwe Archery developmental team has made it into the top three of the World AGA tournament in Namibia, and will fight for a gold medal this Saturday.
It was an action-packed day in Namibia this Friday as the Zimbabwe Archery team sought to overcome stiff competition from several countries in pursuit of a better finish at the World AGA tournament.
Andrew Manning emerged as Zimbabwe’s top archer at the event.

news.title: Dynamos and Yadah set for Chibuku Cup showdown
news.content:
Story by ZBC Reporter
CHIBUKU Super Cup defending champions, Dynamos, will go through the preliminary stage in order to qualify for the first round of the prestigious tournament.
Following this Thursday’s draw held in Harare, the struggling Harare giants will have to navigate their way past Yadah in the preliminary round for a ticket into the first round of the cup competition, where they will face log leaders Simba Bhora.
Another preliminary round match features 18th-placed Kwekwe United and fellow strugglers Triangle United.
Meanwhile, the first round draw will see premiership debutants MWOS clashing with CAPS United in a potentially explosive match.
Scottland face Green Fuel, rejuvenated FC Platinum have a date with Manica Diamonds, TelOne play Bikita Minerals, ZPC Kariba clash with Chicken Inn, and Herentals have been drawn against Highlanders.

news.title: Zimbabwe hosts youth football symposium ahead of COSAFA U17
